page.title: 04Education 1 - Llanarth Ct
page.content: Llanarth Court School The school consists of 2 large buildings, Court House and Roch House. It also has a block of classrooms called 'The Stables', a chapel, tennis courts and outdoor swimming pool are in the grounds. There are 106 pupils, 9 full time teachers and 7 Benedictine monks. The school is a Roman Catholic establishment and all the monks live within the school. The school has 65 acres of land. Most pupils are boarders but there are 30 day boys and girls and weekly boarders. It is a prep school with a pre-prep dept. so children stay from the ages of 5 to 13. Children come from as far away as Zambia, Hong Kong and Iraq, but many are also local.
